result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Balistriere II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court finds defendant eligible for Substance Abuse Program only after serving 2 years confinement.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall participate in an AODA assessment and all counseling or treatment programs as directed by his supervising agent. 
Defendant shall pay Dept of Corrections supervision fees.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall take medications only as prescribed. 
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment.
Defendant shall maintain a stable residence.
Defendant shall notify his supervising agent within 48 hrs of being prescribed medications.
Defendant shall notify his health care providers of his addiction history. 
Defendant shall use only one designated pharmacy for filling all prescriptions.
If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with people who possess or use drugs nor be upon any premises where drugs are used or sold.
Defendant shall not enter any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol.
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J Balistriere II
